intro: Salsola androssowii, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing shrub or perennial herb that thrives in sandy or saline soils. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and adapted to reduce water loss. Salsola androssowii plays a role in stabilizing soils and is often found in desert ecosystems.
